question.title: Plugin com.googlecode.mavennatives.maven-nativedependencies-plugin not found
question.body:
I'm trying to install following the docs, but I'm receiving an error when I try to install the native dependency plugin:

Plugin [id: 'com.googlecode.mavennatives.maven-nativedependencies-plugin', version: '0.0.7'] was not found in any of the following sources:

* Try:
> Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.
> Run with --scan to get full insights.
> Get more help at https://help.gradle.org.

* Exception is:
org.gradle.api.plugins.UnknownPluginException: Plugin [id: 'com.googlecode.mavennatives.maven-nativedependencies-plugin', version: '0.0.7'] was not found in any of the following sources:

- Gradle Core Plugins (plugin is not in 'org.gradle' namespace)
- Included Builds (No included builds contain this plugin)
- Plugin Repositories (could not resolve plugin artifact 'com.googlecode.mavennatives.maven-nativedependencies-plugin:com.googlecode.mavennatives.maven-nativedependencies-plugin.gradle.plugin:0.0.7')
  Searched in the following repositories:
    maven(https://maven.pkg.jetbrains.space/public/p/compose/dev)
    maven2(https://repo1.maven.org/maven2)
    Google
    Gradle Central Plugin Repository
    MavenRepo

This is my settings.gradle.kts file:

pluginManagement {
    repositories {
        maven("https://maven.pkg.jetbrains.space/public/p/compose/dev")
        maven("https://repo1.maven.org/maven2")
        google()
        gradlePluginPortal()
        mavenCentral()
    }
}

plugins {
  //https://github.com/JetBrains/compose-hot-reload?tab=readme-ov-file#set-up-automatic-provisioning-of-the-jetbrains-runtime-jbr-via-gradle
  id("org.gradle.toolchains.foojay-resolver-convention").version("0.10.0")
  id("com.googlecode.mavennatives.maven-nativedependencies-plugin").version("0.0.7")
}

rootProject.name = "demo"
  • OS: Windows 11
  • JDK: 21 but also happens with 17
  • Gradle: 8.8
  • IDE: IntelliJIDEA

What am I doing wrong?

question_comments.body: Also note that the maven-nativedependencies-plugin for Maven is basically abandoned and not even recommended by its maintainers: github.com/fmarot/nativedependencies-maven/blob/master/…
